snippet: The Orleans Parish sheriff will no longer honor many requests from the federal immigration authorities to hold people who are suspected of being here illegally in jail.
abstract: Orleans Parish sheriff will no longer honor requests from federal immigration authorities to detain people who are suspected of being in country illegally, making New Orleans one of a growing number of jurisdictions to adopt such a policy and the first to do so in the Deep South.
lead_paragraph: The Orleans Parish sheriff will no longer honor many requests from the federal immigration authorities to hold people who are suspected of being here illegally in jail.

headline.main: New Orleans and U.S. in Standoff on Detentions
headline.print_headline: New Orleans And U.S. In Standoff On Detentions
